channel.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
channel.description:
so yeah , i sort of had it with RSPS , i do however want to learn more about coding and making games. but anything i have learned so far is how to [b]edit[/b] a given source , i was wondering if there is any tutorial out on how to actually [b]make[/b] a 2d game from upper corner angle. I have searched the net for some guides and tutorials , but none of them really tell how to add graphics and models and such to the game , most of those tutorials are just some lame messages showing up in a CMD , i want to learn much more then just that.
So , if anybody knows a good tutorial for making 3d games with Java ; i'd appreciate it =D Thanks , Cres

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

javac - Command for compiling within a batch file.
java - Command for running compiled class files

Need more help? Search up some basic JAVA tutorials.

Read full topic
item.source: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:32, topic:374176”][quote author=laurent 248 link=topic=470166.msg3446408#msg3446408 date=1293471841]

Java cant make 3D games, but it give life and function using a cache.

ever heard of JOGL, LWJGL or jMonkeyEngine? And last time I checked Runescape was in 3D

the cache is in 3D you idiot.
[/quote]

you’re the idiot in this case[/quote]I made a game which uses a 2D cache, how do I upgrade it to 3D? :o

Read full topic

Java cant make 3D games, but it give life and function using a cache.
[/quote]

woah dude , you have failed…
do you want some links?
RuneScape , MineCraft , 2 good examples of 3D games , both made in Java
EDIT : although i have never found or seen any clue proving RuneScape is made in Java , however , whenever i play RS a Sun window pops up with Java commands , so i think that more then approves RS is made in Java[/quote]
no shit… the client is in fact written in java.

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:22, topic:374176”][quote author=Graham link=topic=470166.msg3443976#msg3443976 date=1293269603]

no wait , i have to run thm seperatly right?
these are like server and client with RSPS tell me im right =D

skeleton = client
board = server

like that?

You cannot run them in paralell from the same batch file anyways, it can only execute one command at a time, and until one is finished, it cannot go to the next one. No offense though, don’t talk to RSPS noobs, I have had to correct batch file problems for friends, that owners of servers said its right, and nothing can be changed without it fucking up.

You can though, the START command will launch another program but won’t block.
[/quote]
Ofc the ‘start’ command will work, I am talking about using the simple ‘java’ command twice.[/quote]

You implied there was no way to do in your original post…

Read full topic
item.source: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:19, topic:374176”][quote author=Lin link=topic=470166.msg3443744#msg3443744 date=1293249030]
I can’t help but notice this Mendorphins: “animated 3D sprites” Gaaaahhhh!!!

Why do you need a tutorial? Games aren’t that hard to develop. If you know Java well enough to display graphics, you know enough to make a (2D) game. The rest is actually just thinking instead of “Okay, so in games, these are called … and you them by …”.
[/quote]
I’m just quoting what it says. Also, I don’t know Java well enough, so I just go by what I see or hear.

You’re the Guru, not me. Lol.[/quote]
Not even a Guru, he got that for a stupid program to develop interfaces for the 317 client.

Read full topic

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

hmmm , i just found out , that tutorial is written for Linux…
FacePalm to myself…

well , i will follow that big tutorial now , see how that goes , thx everybody for the help =D

EDIT: problem solved by logical sense : in my run.bat , i only did
java filename
it had to be
java -cp . filename

another facepalm to myself…

Read full topic

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:13, topic:374176”][quote author=ollie123 link=topic=470166.msg3443312#msg3443312 date=1293220135]

i’ve got the compiler to work ; there are no errors with my codes , the only problem left is running the program…
will an IDE help with running a program?

An IDE helps with the development. I personally recommend NetBeans: http://www.netbeans.org
[/quote]

I don’t need anything to help with development , all i need now is a way to get my run.bat to work ,

here’s what i have written :

@echo off
echo running
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javaw.exe"
java Board
java Skeleton
pause

Board and Skeleton are just 2 files that are explained in a tutorial.
But yeah , i can’t see how it works if i can’t even run them…
i set the directory to javaw because i thought it would do the same as javac , but then run instead of compile.
also tried without directory , don’t work either[/quote]
I looked at the tutorial, and I believe the ‘skeleton’ class was replaced with the ‘board’ class. I could be wrong, as I only briefly examined it.

As for your batch file, try this:

@echo off
echo running
java -Xmx100m -cp .; Board
pause

Read full topic
item.source: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?

also tried without directory , don’t work either

item.title: Is There Any Big Tutorial On Java Games?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:9, topic:374176”][quote author=_s link=topic=470166.msg3443177#msg3443177 date=1293213847]
why the hell don’t you use an ide
[/quote]

i will pause from pro and go to noob status when i ask what the hell that is? =D[/quote]
From pro to noob? You’re a little full of yourself man. Anyways, an IDE is basically a tool to help you program, spot out errors before you compile, and even correct the stupid ones you might have made. Anyways, that is a very shitty description, but if you want one, I suggest netbeans or even eclipse for java.

Read full topic
